name: AST
description: The model used is based on the work published by another group. ('https://arxiv.org/abs/2104.01778', 'https://github.com/YuanGongND/ast')

args.name: data_train
args.help: path to the training data.

args.name: epochs
args.help: number of training epochs.

args.name: batch_size
args.help: batch size used for training.

args.name: num_workers
args.help: number of subprocesses for data loading.

args.name: data_shuffle
args.help: set to true to shuffle data at every epoch.

args.name: model_dir
args.help: path to the dir with the module's scripts.

args.name: exp_dir
args.help: directory to dump output.

args.name: lr
args.help: learning rate to use for training.

args.name: save_model
args.help: set to true to save the model every n steps.

args.name: fdim
args.help: dimension of frequency bins.

args.name: tdim
args.help: dimension of time bins.

args.name: fstride
args.help: soft split freq stride, overlap=patch_size-stride.

args.name: tstride
args.help: soft split time stride, overlap=patch_size-stride.

args.name: imagenet_pretrain
args.help: set to true to use ImageNet pretrained audio spectrogram transformer model.

args.name: audioset_pretrain
args.help: set to true to use ImageNet and audioset pretrained audio spectrogram transformer model.

args.name: custom_pretrain
args.help: set to true to use a custom set of weights.

args.name: modules_dir
args.help: directory to ast modules.

args.name: data_val
args.help: validation directory.

args.name: n_class
args.help: number of classes.

args.name: data_type
args.help: type of data store in the hdf5

args.name: pretrained_weights_path
args.help: path to pretrained weights file

args.name: verbose
args.help: set to true to get train porgress information.

args.name: mix_up
args.help: set to true to enable mix_up.

args.name: mass_range
args.help: range of masses used for training.

args.name: lambda_range
args.help: range of lambdas used for training.

args.name: desired_eos
args.help: list of EOS used for training.

args.name: n
args.help: number of augmentation layers to use.

args.name: m
args.help: magnitude of augmentation.
